CONJUGATES: when (as adverb, conjunction, and pronoun, it does not inflect)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English hwanne, hwænne, from Proto-Germanic *hwanne (compare Old Saxon hwan, Old High German wanne, Gothic hwan), from Proto-Indo-European *kʷon- (interrogative stem).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Conjunction: a word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: At or after the time that; during which time.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I was just leaving when you called.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 你打电话来的时候我正要离开。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: At what time; on what occasion.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: When did they say they would arrive?

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Conjunction: a word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In view of the fact that; considering that; whereas.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Why do you watch TV when you should be studying?
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 你既然应该学习，为什么还要看电视？

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Pronoun: a word that can function as a noun phrase used by itself and that refers either to the participants in the discourse or to someone or something mentioned elsewhere in the discourse.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The time at which (used as a relative pronoun, often after a noun indicating time).
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I remember the day when we first met.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我记得我们第一次见面的那天。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The time or occasion of an event.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The police are investigating the 'when' and 'where' of the crime.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 警方正在调查该罪行的“何时”和“何地”。
